experience: You and Gail both know Dustin Faultner, SPHR (L.I.O.N.), Chris Silva, and 7 others

Established Data Governance Program for the first Loyalty Coalition Product in the US. By utilizing Agile Principles I was able to have a fully functional Data Governance Program within 4 months supporting the launch of the Plenti Product.To ensure high data quality defined and implemented a Data Quality Assessment Process that provided quality scores for key attributes within DWH Primary contact for the resolution PII data concerns within the DWH and Big Data

Program Manager - Midrange Optimization Services. •	Developed a corporate wide End of Life Server Program coordinating across the Organization a common goal to eliminate antiquated hardware. Created and utilized prioritization model based on a systematic sequenced, rule-based approach that evaluates server infrastructure on multiple key parameters to determine hardware that is at the end of its useful life and should be replaced to reduce risk and increase flexibility. This process received a Patent in 2015  Additional responsibilities include driving app teams to a more optimized environment through removal of Low Utilized Hardware resulting in annual Re-engineering saves of $1MM.

Responsible for the Management and utilization of resources providing the right resource at the right time at the right cost.•Manage the Contractor Resource Center. Work with the Partner Vendors to define the most effective onshore offshore model resulting in a 30% reduction in blended rate with year over year saves of $2m. Provide metrics on Contractor usage and costs.•Responsible for defining and implementing financial planning tools to support the Centralized Resource Center.  Developed guidelines for Work Structure Breakout and the use of Work Force Management to manage the demand/supply model and then managing and tracking to the $62m budget. •Managed the Right Sourcing Program, with an emphasis on driving down costs, building out a more effective offshore model, ensuring that project demand is filled with the right resource at the right price with the right skills at the right time. This included providing executive level reporting and building the Business Case supporting the year over year saves of $9 million. •Drove delivery of the Resource Center Management Processes to support the IT Organization’s move to a Centralized Resource Center Model for the staffing of all IT work.

Responsibilities included driving the Global NT4 Migration, defining the hardware refresh strategy and processes and developing the WAS 3.5 uplift strategy•Took over the at risk Global NT4 to WINTEL migration program consisting of 1400 servers and 1100 applications across the Globe. Reorganized and realigned the team to include shared goals and risks for both the Partner Vendor and the Corporation. Resulted in Vendor taking back overall ownership of the Program which enabled a budget reduction of $1.5m to the Corporation, avoiding the $6m cost from Mircrosoft to continue support for NT4, and meeting project completion goals for 2005.•Initiated the WAS 3.5 uplift Program working across the organization to build out a Financial Model to compare Pseries to Intel to current WAS costs. The model was adopted by the Development Groups to validate the pricing received from IBM for Pseries solution vs an Intel Solution. Resulting in $15.5 million quote reduction across the Organization.
Director IT, Interactive Development Merchant Services

Responsible for Merchant Services Applications within the mainframe and interactive space. Specializing in the implementation of high volume high usage Accounts Payable Systems for both Domestic and International Markets. •Lead cross organization team to resolve Merchant Site availability. Site supported 500k users per month with 4.4m page hits per month.  Determined decrease in availability was a direct result of poor application design in the area of cross platform data retrieval (UDB, DB2 & Mainframe). Provided technical direction to technical staff on the corrective action required and instituted the Design and Performance Review team to review all proposed changes to the applications to insure future releases would not impact site availability. Resulted in site availability being brought to and maintained at 98% with zero software releases impacting site availability. •Drove application design and development for the Stored Value Travel Product Applications. Delivered the upgrade from VB to J2EE Websphere 3.5 interfacing with DB2 Mainframe via MQ hub infrastructure. Promoted Adaptive Architecture design resulting in 17 components being removed. This architecture supported seasonal increases in transaction volume and concurrent User base, promoted component re-use, increased transaction volume capability and reduced time to market for similar products. Upgrade resulted in an increase in revenue of $42m and a time to market reduction from 6 months to 3 months for additional stored value products.
